definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: And Vergeer admits that "sometimes it's tiring always trying to improve.
sentences.chinese: 沃吉爾承認，“有時會對無盡的提高而感到厭煩。”

sentences.english: Sometimes a lack of information can lead workers to misperceive that there's preferential treatment, says Mr. Reed.
sentences.chinese: 裏德說，有時候信息的缺乏會讓員工誤以爲老闆偏心。

sentences.english: But sometimes, ISP's and mail service businesses have no interest in righting what went wrong.
sentences.chinese: 但有時，互聯網的業務和郵件服務沒有興趣糾正想歪。

sentences.english: The thickened septa are most often smooth, but septal nodules may sometimes be seen.
sentences.chinese: 增厚的小葉間隔常平滑，但有時可呈結節狀。

sentences.english: Sometimes, I'm a fish on the band .
sentences.chinese: 有時候，我也是一條岸上的小魚兒。

sentences.english: In the fall we sometimes hear honks as a flock of geese flies south.
sentences.chinese: 到了秋天，有時我們能聽到南飛雁羣的叫聲。

sentences.english: Small seashells have sometimes been used as a primitive kind of money.
sentences.chinese: 小貝殼有時用作簡單的錢幣。

sentences.english: Occasionally, by now, Is lipped and called him Scampy.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我說漏嘴，也叫它“小淘氣”。

sentences.english: Errors indeed in this virtue of goodness, or charity, may be committed.
sentences.chinese: 但人性中這種仁善的傾向，有時也會犯錯誤。

sentences.english: Sometimes the best answer is silence.
sentences.chinese: 有時沉默是最好的答案。

sentences.english: Sometimes riders urge their horses on with whips.
sentences.chinese: 騎馬的人有時用鞭子策馬前進。

sentences.english: Sometimes I think we all watched too many episodes of “The Waltons.
sentences.chinese: 有時，我覺得我們都看了過多的《沃爾頓家族》劇集。

sentences.english: But sometimes DHL they will diverge parcel inspection, then their own packaging.
sentences.chinese: 但有時DHL他們會岔開包裹檢查，然後自己包裝。

sentences.english: The dirt roads were, at times, impassible because of the heavy tropical rains.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，熱帶暴雨讓泥路無法行走。

sentences.english: It is hardly surprising if students sometimes find this kind of make-believe question a waste of their time.
sentences.chinese: 不難看到，學生有時覺得這類問題是在浪費時間。

sentences.english: Sometimes, he gets so sulky that he just stays in his tent and fasts.
sentences.chinese: 有時候他就只會呆在自己的帳篷裏不喫東西生悶氣。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
